title: Thug attacks woman in vicious street brawl as terrified onlookers scream
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest daily news stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

A thug appeared to jab a woman while she fought with a rival during a vicious street brawl in London.

The incident happened outside an Indian restaurant and grocery shop in Manor Park, East London, on October 2.

Footage shared on social media shows two women fighting in the street near a car when a man approaches them and appears to jab one of them repeatedly with what looks like an object.

He then walks away as the two women continue fighting on the ground.

As police intervene to calm the situation, some officers can be heard shouting: "Stay over there", "move out of the way", "who's been stabbed?"

Police have confirmed nobody was stabbed during the altercation and that there were no reports of serious injury.

A person can be heard screaming in front of onlookers, in the footage.

(Image: Twitter)

The video, which appeared on Mail Online, has been posted on Twitter.

A Scotland Yard spokesman said: "Police were called at approximately 19:50hrs on Wednesday, 2 October to reports of a number of people fighting in High Street North, E12.



"Officers attended the scene.

(Image: Twitter)

(Image: Twitter)



"Two women, both aged in their 20s, were arrested on suspicion of GBH and taken to east London police stations – both have been bailed pending further enquiries to dates in late October.



"No reports of any serious injuries; no reports of anyone being stabbed.



"Enquiries into the circumstances remain ongoing.



"Anyone with information is asked to contact police on 101 or tweet @MetCC and quote CAD7368/2Oct.



"Alternatively, contact Crimestoppers anonymously on 0800 555 111."
description: Police officers can be heard saying "stay over there", "move out of the way", and "who's been stabbed?" at the scene of the altercation, in Manor Park, London
